newsitem.title: USA: Grupo Televisa in internal battle - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Grupo Televisa in internal battle - WSJ.

text.p: In the three months since its chairman, Emilio Azcarrago Milmo, died, Grupo Televisa SA has erupted into internal turmoil over leadership of the media company, the Wall Street Journal said.
In Wednesday's electronic edition, the Journal said the fight pits Chief Operating office Guillermo Canedo White against former Televisa Vice President Alejandro Burillo Azcarrago.
Unnamed sources at the company told the Journal the battle will likely lead to the departure of Canedo.
The fight has left the investment community uneasy.
"This has been a ridiculous, prolonged affair," one New York analyst who covers the company said. "It's been trickling through the market for two months now, and people just want this to end."
